title: The Great Jack O'Lantern Blaze
description: • Now in its 21st year, The Great Jack O’Lantern Blaze returns to Van Cortlandt Manor in Croton-on-Hudson for another season of gord-geous displays. Held Sept. 12–Nov. 16, visitors can wander among more than 7,000 hand-carved, illuminated jack o’lanterns arranged in jaw-dropping displays. 2025 promised to be a magical year with several new installations, including a Pumpkin Promenade, Headless Horseman Hideaway for spooky sips and haunting visits from the Horseman himself, plus a new emerald-hued storybook pumpkin dreamscape – wickedly whimsical and perfect for photo ops.

title: Alexander Jackson Davis: Designer of Dreams
description: The Lyndhurst Mansion is a masterpiece of architect Alexander Jackson Davis. This exhibition will explore Davis’s career as an architect and furniture designer through the designing and building of Lyndhurst, his extant Gothic revival masterpiece, and other homes in the region. The exhibit will be on view in the Welcome Center complex and open between 11 am and 5 pm on tour days.

title: Garden Highlights Tour
description: Please join one of the gardeners for a one hour walking tour of the plants of Lasdon Park, Westchester’s Public Garden. See seasonal flowering in our garden collections which include flowering and fruiting shrubs and trees, native plants, annuals and perennials. Rain or shine, meet at the Kiosk entrance at the top of the parking lot.
location: Lasdon Park, Arboretum and Veterans Museum

title: Hudson River Valley Ramble
description: Discover the scenic, natural, cultural and historical riches of the beautiful Hudson River valley national heritage area, as well as its amazing landscape, communities, and trails at the annual Hudson River Valley Ramble. This year’s ramble will be taking place every day from August 30th through the end of September. From New York City to Albany, there are over 200 exciting events and activities for all ages and ability levels. The ramble truly offers something for everyone, whether it’s discovering the region’s significant role in the revolutionary war; taking a challenging hike, bike ride or paddle; or enjoying an inspiring walk through the historic estates of some of the valley’s most notable Americans.
location: Locations throughout the Hudson Valley River Greenway

title: Julie's Girls Club Queer Speed-Friending at Happy Valley Arcade Bar
description: Come on down to make some new friends as Julie's Girls Club hosts Queer Speed-Friending at Happy Valley Arcade Bar! All gender identities and sexual orientations are welcome! This event will be super introvert-friendly, and there will even be funny little icebreakers and name tags! Food and drinks will be available for purchase throughout the whole event. DM @juliesgirlsclub if you have any questions at all.

title: Savor the Summer
description: Savor the Summer is a community-centered, outdoor fundraiser designed to: Celebrate the ending of summer with good food, music, and company. Showcase the talent and creativity of the SEAT Center Culinary Lab. Raise funds and awareness to support SEAT Center's mission of youth workforce development in the Capital Region. Event Features: Alfresco dining stations created and served by students from SEAT's Culinary Lab. Summer's Harvest Grazing Table with meats/ cheeses/ seasonal fruits and vegetables; Artisanal Fired Pizzas Grilled Skewers w/ dipping sauces; and Hattie's Culinary Lab Seasonal Creations. Curated beverages Beer / Hard Seltzer Station: Cans/Bottles ; includes zero alcohol ; Wine Station: includes zero alcohol Prosecco; Vodka/ Mocktail Station; Bourbon/ Mocktail Station. Live music by the BWC Jazz Orchestra- 18 piece big band sound.

title: Pie Night At Dominique Ansel Bakery
description: Once a year, we celebrate the arrival of autumn (and the start of pie season!) with our annual Pie Nights at Dominique Ansel Bakery in Soho, in our beautiful outdoor garden. Enjoy unlimited slices of our 10 different homemade pies, including both sweet and savory options, along specialty craft cocktails that we’ll top off for your throughout the evening, ice cream to make your slices à la mode, and a few more surprises along the way.

title: Sunset Yoga at Rockwood
description: Relieve stress and explore the connection between breath and movement with instructor Shivani Singh as the sun sets over the Hudson with views of the palisades and NYC in the distance. Appropriate for all levels of experience, ages 18+. Cost: $6 per class. Photo courtesy of Kim Fendrich. RockefellerStateParkPreserve.org/events
